text: The initiation phase involves homolytic breakdown of hydrogen in the α - position relative to the fatty acid chain double bond , leading to the formation of an allyl radical . These species are highly unstable , short - lived intermediates that stabilize themselves by abstracting hydrogen from another chemical species or rapidly react with oxygen to form a peroxyl radical ( propagation phase ) . In the propagation phase , peroxyl radicals formed can further oxidise the lipid , producing hydroperoxides .
